basics.name: Evan Plaice
basics.label: FullStack Engineer
basics.summary: Full-Stack Developer (3+ years FTE, 10+ OpenSource). Specialties: Networking, Parsing, Application Development, Open Source Expert. Software Dev Generalist. I work best in small, highly specialized teams. Well versed in training, mentorship, and leadership roles.

work.name: Open Source
work.description: Took a year hiatus to work on Open Source R&D new/emerging technologies
highlights: Dev: Created the @VanillaWC Organization and published 14 web components
Dev: Created the @VanillaES Organization, published 4 libraries, and 3 CLI tools
Dev: Landed the 'ESM Compatibility' RFC and PR into ESLint core
Community: Participated on node/modules team planning ESM support for Node
R&D: Established 'Best Practices' for working with standard Web Components
R&D: Established 'Best Practices' for developing Universal JS libraries and tooling

work.name: Coder Technologies Inc
work.description: Coder is a cloud-native IDE (Integrated Development Environment) based on VSCode
highlights: Dev: Worked on the main product UI from the early alpha stages through product launch (Typescript)
Dev: Scaffolded the VSCode plugin integration API (Typescript)
Dev: Contributed to and polished the FrontEnd website UI leading up to launch (Typescript React)
QA: Built out the E2E testing automation, including integration with CI/CD (Selenium)

work.name: WiseConnect Inc
work.description: WiseConnect specializes in Copper and FiberOptic telecommunications installation and support
highlights: Leadership: Provided training, mentorship, and QA for the Denver team
Tech/CS: Performed 1K+ install/repair jobs

work.name: 24 Hour Alert Systems
work.description: 24HR is a contract installation for DISH Network
highlights: Tech/CS: Performed 1.5k+ install/repair jobs

work.name: Strike Group LLC
work.description: SG is a DVSOB certified DOD contractor. I represented MARCORSYSCOM ComCam for West Coast/Pacific AOR
highlights: CS: Provided logistics and help/desk support for 11 units across 6 military bases
Logistics: Fielded and tracked $5+ million in visual imagery and military hardware
Tech: Repaired Xerox MFDs, updated laptops (120+) quarterly, and administered the 3 TIPS networks
Leadership: Advised COMCAM Unit Chiefs/Officers and frequently led small teams of Marines
Leadership: Led semi-annual training sessions on TIPS (Tactical Imagery Production System) deployment
Leadership: Fielded the TIPS on 3 training evolutions (ie large scale deployment exercises)
Dev: Designed, built, and maintained company's online presence @ StrikeGroup.org
Credentials: Earned 2 Xerox MFD Certifications and acquired a 'Public Trust' clearance
Awards: Received a 'Commendation for Exemplary Performance' for my role in DesertScimitar14

work.name: JPA Inc (RIOS)
work.description: Co-Developed the RIOS for FedEx throughout all stages of planning and development
highlights: Product: Led product development from the PDR (Preliminary Design Review) thru Acceptance
Arch: Designed the communications, systems, n-tier, and IPC (Inter Process Communications) architecture
Dev: Build parsers for ARINC-424, the host datapool, and ported the floating-point conversion lib from C to C#
Dev: Implemented a custom Layer 2 network protocol client/server for host interaction
Dev: Implemented the database layer. Incl datapool, ARINC424, cache layer, queries, and stored procedures
Dev: Build dynamic 2D projections to graph the Glideslope and ILS deviation plots
Dev/Tech: Performed the onsite installation and host integration per the agreed (7 day) schedule
Hardware: Specified and assembled the rackmount PC, backups, hot spares, and touchscreen displays
QA: Worked on-site with the Check Pilot to integrate last-minute look-and-feel changes/fixes

work.name: JPA Inc
work.description: Hacking on commercial full flight aircraft simulators for fun and profit
highlights: Hardware: Designed, implemented, installed, and updated avionics instruments and systems. Incl EGPWS, TCAS, TAWS, etc
Hardware: Worked Electrical or Rigging for 5 Level D Flight Simulator Relocations and 2 door trainers
Tech: Provided on-site support through the Level D FAA baseline certification of a 747-400
Eng: Researched, red lined, and drew est 200+ electrical prints
Dev: Designed, built, and maintained the company online presence

work.name: SATCO LLC
work.description: SATCO specialized in the manufacture of Level D FFS (Full Flight Simulator) and FTD (Fixed Training Devices)
highlights: Hardware: Manufactured avionics cables, wiring harnesses, instrument panels

awards.title: Commendation for Performance
awards.summary: Received for my onsite participation as technical SME during the first field deployment of the Tactical Imagery Production System V3.0.
